intro: Convolvulus dorycnium subsp. dorycnium, commonly known as the Persian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and bloom in the morning, hence its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
